snippet: The legislature approved an electronic surveillance law that critics feared would markedly expand electronic surveillance of French residents and businesses.
abstract: France's legislature passes electronic surveillance law that critics fear will markedly expand electronic surveillance of French residents and businesses; Internet and corporate groups, human rights organizations and small number of lawmakers oppose law as threat to business or an encroachment on individual rights.
lead_paragraph: The legislature approved an electronic surveillance law that critics feared would markedly expand electronic surveillance of French residents and businesses.
